page.title: 14SOMERHILL IN TUDELEY, CAPEL
page.content: THE MANSION OF SOMERHILL IS SITUATED IN TUDELEY LANE A MILE AND A HALF FROM TONBRIDGE. IT WAS BUILT ON LAND GIVEN TO FRANCES WALSINGHAM BY ELIZABETH I IN 1611. LATER JOHN WOODGATE BOUGHT IT AND FARMED THE LAND.IN 1849 THE ESTATE WAS PURCHASED BY ISAAC GOLDSMID. BILL AND LOUIE WATTS PURCHASED SOMERHILL IN 1979 FROM CHLOE TEACHER,SIR HARRY D'AVIGDOR GOLDSMID'S SECOND DAUGHTER. HIS FIRST DAUGHTER DIED TRAGICALLY IN A SAILING ACCIDENT OFF THE COAST AT RYE. A STAINED GLASS WINDOW IN TUDELEY CHURCH, DEDICATED TO HER, WAS DESIGNED BY THE LATE MARC CHAGALL.A PHOTO TAKEN AT SOMERHILL IN THE FIRST WORLD WAR SHOWS WOUNDED SOLDIERS RECUPERATING THERE. THE PRESENT OWNER PLANS TO MAKE SOMERHILL INTO A LUXURIOUS HOTEL AND CONFERENCE CENTRE. SOMERHILL CAN ALSO BE HIRED FOR WEDDING RECEPTIONS,GARDEN PARTIES, BARBECUES AND OUTSIDE EVENTS.
